data.text: @MoriartyLab @picardonhealth @awong37 @bradwouters @CPHO_Canada @GovCanHealth @jkwan_md @JillianHortonMD @LeylaDAsadi @MPaiMD @NGrandvaux Curious of your thoughts as to why Sask has a lower percentage of people infected compared to Manitoba? Sask has had the least restrictions of all provinces. Did our HUGE delta wave provide some sort of protection against omicron?

@gullcoveroad @Averyflash @Stay2mApart @MoriartyLab @picardonhealth @awong37 @bradwouters @CPHO_Canada @GovCanHealth @jkwan_md @JillianHortonMD @LeylaDAsadi @MPaiMD @NGrandvaux Well, wrote with others with loosely connected expertise…she of Fac. Of Dentistry at U of T with…surprise…internationally recognized expertise in Lyme disease. So, it all fits.

@MoriartyLab Is 0-27% of Manitobans 40 & up currently being susceptible to Omicron infection a small piece of good news 'cause it may mean lower infection, hospitalization, and ICU rates in the near future?

(Obvs is a consequence of something bad—namely, previously high rates infection.)

@MoriartyLab @picardonhealth @awong37 @bradwouters @CPHO_Canada @GovCanHealth @jkwan_md @JillianHortonMD @LeylaDAsadi @MPaiMD @NGrandvaux @COVIDSciOntario @RicharLisa @ASPphysician @AntibioticDoc @LisaBarrettID @Billius27 @BogochIsaac @KrishanaSankar @angie_rasmussen @brittlestar @MaryFernando_ Interesting data! Q:Was the expected fatality rate constant across provinces? If not, and the actual fatality fate in MB/AB was higher than expected, would that overestimate the # of cases? MB had lots of deaths, but maybe due to higher fatality rate not higher uncaught cases? ty

@MoriartyLab 82% in Manitoba, I know a lot of people in Brandon, Winnipeg and Portage La Prairie Manitoba, none of them have had it and none of them know anyone with it. My 87 year old uncle was in a Winnipeg hospital with two broken vertebrae and contracted covid. He is out and doing fine.
@dbcurren @MoriartyLab Thanks, Don! I feel mostly fatigued with a sore throat and I am hoping this is as bad as it gets.

@MoriartyLab ... and this morning, I have tested positive as well.

We were both unmasked at home the night before she tested positive, so not a surprise.

@MoriartyLab @picardonhealth @awong37 @bradwouters @CPHO_Canada @GovCanHealth @jkwan_md @JillianHortonMD @LeylaDAsadi @MPaiMD @NGrandvaux Well, thanks for taking away any reason for people of MB to wear masks after the 15th. Everyone will think that they are immune to BA.2. I am guessing that with a maskless MB, Omicron can go after the vulnerable immunocompromised people with abandon.
